title: The amount of disk space incorrent when mount Team Drives (gdrive) in Windows 10
body:
#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

When use rclone and winfsp to mount Google Team Drives in Windows 10, The amount of disk space is not corrent. The amount of disk space should bigger than 1TB or unlimited , but it looks like the space of personal Google Drive, such as 15G.

> The config of rclone shows like:
![Config](https://i.loli.net/2018/05/02/5ae9be5c81731.jpg)

> The result after mount command.  The size of My Drive is 17G, but not 15G. And the it tells `LocalDisk(X:), 16.9G available, 17G total`
![Mount](https://i.loli.net/2018/05/02/5ae9c02ec0e44.jpg)

#### What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)

rclone v1.41             
- os/arch: windows/amd64 
- go version: go1.10     

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)

Windows 10, 64 bit, 1709

####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)

Google Drive

#### The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

`rclone mount GDrive:/ x: --cache-dir F:\Temp --vfs-cache-mode writes`

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

```
Î» rclone mount GDrive:/ x: --cache-dir F:\Temp --vfs-cache-mode writes -vv
```
